alert.note: Alert for Washington (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 3:24PM CDT until March 30 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON AND BOLIVAR COUNTIES... At 324 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lexa to near Sherard to near Shaw, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Washington and Bolivar Counties, including the following locations... Alligator, Winstonville, Duncan, Pace and Merigold. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
